properties.areaDesc: Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon; Northwest Blue Mountains; Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 1 at 10:57AM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
A cold front traveling south across Washington and Oregon will
bring snow to the Blue Mountains this evening. Although overnight
snow accumulations are not expected to be significant, there will
be around six to eight hours of moderate snow, mainly from 6 PM
to midnight. Accumulations of 3 to 5 inches over the Blue
Mountains north of Ukiah can be expected during this time.
Snowfall rates of one half to one inch per hour will cause snow to
accumulate fast on the roadways and significantly reduce
visibilities. If traveling over the Blue Mountains is not required
this evening, you may prefer to postpone travel until Sunday when
snow tapers off.

The Blue Mountains south of Ukiah, the Grande Ronde, Wallowa
Valley, the John Day Basin and surrounding mountains will have
snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches tonight. Snow levels will
lower to around 2500 feet in eastern Oregon overnight.

NWSheadline: MODERATE SNOW THIS EVENING IN THE BLUE MOUNTAINS
